data.title: Owen Chamberlain: Physicist at Los Alamos, Berkeley, Professor, 1950-1989, Nobel Laureate
data.meta_description: Childhood in San Francisco and Philadelphia; undergraduate education at Dartmouth, graduate work in physics at UC Berkeley; professors at Berkeley: J. Robert Oppenheimer, Emilio Segr√Ø¬ø¬Ω, Ernest Lawrence; work on the atomic bomb at Los Alamos during World War II; physicists at Los Alamos: Enrico Fermi, Clyde Wiegand, Edward Teller; postwar graduate work at the University of Chicago; UC Berkeley Radiation Lab, and colleagues Bob Thornton, Ed Lofgren, Carl Helmholz, Raymond Birge, Luis Alvarez; Nobel Prize in physics, 1959, with Segr√Ø¬ø¬Ω for work on antiproton; involvement with anti-nuclear activism, late research in physics.
